description: Network validation errors (such as port in use) result in a 500 error because the exceptions are not subclassed correctly
title: Exceptions raised by quantum validate_networks result in 500 error

comments.content: Network validation errors (such as port in use) result in a 500 error because the exceptions are not subclassed correctly
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~philip-day

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/34015
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/14733455cf28cee926f5be82998b84d570ee206f
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 14733455cf28cee926f5be82998b84d570ee206f
Author: Phil Day <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri Jun 21 17:37:01 2013 +0100

    Exceptions raised by quantum validate_networks result in 500 error
    
    The exceptions raised by validate_networks should be subclassed
    from Invalid so they result in a 400 error
    
    These exceptions are also used in allocate_for_instance
    
    Fixes bug 1193421
    
    Change-Id: If708e413d81a9d32bf81e7821d876736c4ac40ef
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
